official-title.#text: To require the Secretary of Defense to develop and implement a plan to provide chiropractic health care services and benefits for certain new beneficiaries as part of the TRICARE program.

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

short-title.#text: Chiropractic Health Parity for Military Beneficiaries Act

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text: Chiropractic health care for retirees, dependents, and survivors

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall complete development of a plan to provide chiropractic health care services and benefits, as a permanent part of the TRICARE program, for covered beneficiaries.
, for the delivery of health care services shall—
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 1097 of title 10, United States Code

text.#text: The plan shall require that a contract entered into under
include the delivery of chiropractic services;
require that chiropractic services may be provided only by a doctor of chiropractic; and
provide that a covered beneficiary may select and have direct access to a doctor of chiropractic without referral by another health practitioner.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall provide for implementation of the plan to begin no later than January 31, 2014.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Chiropractic Health Parity for Military Beneficiaries Act/s:2/ss:a

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: and as authorized under State law; and

text.#text: includes diagnosis (including by diagnostic x-ray tests), evaluation and management, and therapeutic services for the treatment of a patient's health condition, including neuromusculoskeletal conditions and the subluxation complex, and such other services determined appropriate by the
does not include the use of drugs or surgery.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 1072(5) of title 10, United States Code

term.#tail: means only a doctor of chiropractic who is licensed as a doctor of chiropractic, chiropractic physician, or chiropractor by a State, the District of Columbia, or a territory or possession of the United States.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 1072(7) of title 10, United States Code
